title: BBC Local Live: Greater Manchester on Monday 19 September 2016 - BBC News
summary: firefighters free a worker trapped by a lorry in ancoats .
three men from south manchester are jailed for raping a teenage girl .
'old man ' driving mobility scooter stopped on m60 .
charity bike ride begins for viola beach band member killed in sweden crash .
murder of teenage girl in 1971 to feature on bbc crimewatch .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates from greater manchester and east cheshire have finished for the day , but we 'll be back from 08:00 on tuesday with the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the region .

documents.title: weather : dry with sunny spells
text: a bright afternoon with sunny spells .
this evening will be dry but fairly cloudy .
overnight lows of about 13c .
more from bbc weather
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: places in greater manchester that people always pronounce wrongly
text: a national list of the most hard-to-pronounce place names has just been released .
but greater manchester has its fair share .
author: Manchester Evening News

documents.title: rio paralym 2016 : dame sarah storey elected to ipc athletes ' council
text: great britain 's 14-time paralympic gold medallist dame sarah storey has been elected to the international paralympic committee ( ipc ) athletes ' council .
storey , 38 , who is gb 's most decorated female paralympian , won three golds in rio and is among four athletes elected .
the athletes ' council operates as a liaison body between the ipc , athletes and the wider paralympic movement .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: football : man utd lacking width , a playmaker and a plan
text: for a team with some of the best players in europe , manchester united 's performance in their 3-1 defeat by watford was nowhere near the level i would expect .
united were sloppy and they did the sort of simple things badly - like losing runners , or kicking 30-yard passes straight out of play - that are the basics for top-quality teams .
watford deserve some credit , of course , for breaking the game up and playing well themselves .
but united were just not at it for long periods at vicarage road , and part of their problem was that they did not really look like they had a set gameplan when they came forward .
author: Danny Murphy
Former England midfielder on Radio 5 live

documents.title: christie nurse to complete seven marathons in seven days
text: a nurse at manchester 's christie hospital is on track to complete seven marathons in seven days .
emma widdowson says she has been inspired by the people she treats and has dressed to represent a different cancer every day .

documents.title: firms ' waste disposal issues
text: wigan businesses are struggling to do the right thing with their waste , with almost half admitting to practices that mean they are not complying fully with the law .
author: Wigan Today

documents.title: gary neville 's skyscraper plans are 'grossly inappropriate '
text: more than 1,000 people have signed a petition against gary neville 's proposed city centre development - calling it 'grossly inappropriate ' .
author: Manchester Evening News
Manchester Evening News

documents.title: oldham town hall reopening date announced
text: oldham council has confirmed a date to reopen the old town hall which has had a £ 28m revamp to turn it into a leisure complex .
the grade ii listed building will include a cinema - after 30 years without one in the town centre .
the venue also include restaurants when it officially reopens on 21 october .

documents.title: nearly 100 domestic abuse arrests in a week
text: almost 100 people have been arrested in greater manchester for domestic abuse in the past week .
gmp 's month-long operation scratch comes eight months after a change in the law made coercive and controlling behaviour in relationships illegal .
officers are urging people to report sus or get support if they are a victim .

documents.title: latest headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire
text: latest headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire

documents.title: football : manchester united defender luke shaw to have scan on groin injury
text: manchester united and england defender luke shaw will have a scan on a long-standing groin injury .
shaw played 85 minutes of sunday 's 3-1 defeat by watford , after which he was criticised by manager jose mourinho .
the portuguese said the 21-year-old , who returned at the start of the season after breaking his leg last september , was too far away from nordin amrabat in the build-up to watford 's second goal .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: two stockport care homes rated 'inadequate '
text: two care homes in the stockport area have been rated as `` inadequate '' in a recent inspection by the care quality commission .
the cqc criticised standards at rosemount care home in edgeley and newlands in heaton moor .
rosemount told bbc radio manchester a new manager had been appointed just before the inspection and is working to improve the service .
hc one limited , which runs newlands nursing home is yet to comment .

documents.title: drivers urged to put phones on flight mode
text: police advise motorists to put their phone to flight mode while driving to `` remove temptation '' .
want to remove temptation to use a phone whilst driving ?
why not set it to `` flight mode '' & leave it in your pocket !
it 's not prohibited to have it on my dash displaying google maps however i would n't dare taking it into my hands while driving

documents.title: latest headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire
text: latest headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire

documents.title: plans for £ 45m campus at stockport special school
text: a special school for disabled children in stockport has submitted plans for a new £ 45m campus .
the seashell trust in cheadle hulme want to demolish its existing buildings to create a new school on the same site .
the trust is hoping to raise the money by selling off part of the land is owns to a housing developer for up to 300 new homes on greenbelt land , next to the a34 .

documents.title: trio plied schoolgirl with drink and drugs before gang raping her at house party
text: three men have been locked up for over forty years for gang raping a schoolgirl at a house party .
author: Manchester Evening News
Manchester Evening News

documents.title: half of bucket lists remain unticked , new figures show
text: over half of us in the north west will leave our `` bucket list '' unticked , according to new figures .
statistics from the british heart foundation shows more than 50 % of us have never visited the eiffel tower .
the charity says our region seems to be `` dreamers rather than doers '' .
there are currently nearly 902,000 people living with heart and circulatory disease in the north west .

documents.title: residents turn out in force to oppose stockton heath library closure proposals
text: residents turned out in force to oppose proposals to close their library at stockton heath parish council 's meeting last tuesday .
author: Warrington Guardian

documents.title: 'old man ' driving mobility scooter stopped on m60
text: an `` old man '' riding a mobility scooter on the hard shoulder of the m60 near the trafford centre has been stopped by police .
it happened on the hard shoulder of the m60 close to barton bridge near the trafford centre , greater manchester at about 11:25 on sunday .
witnesses who were concerned for the man 's safety contacted officers after seeing him on a slip road .

documents.title: weather : bright spells developing
text: drying up into this afternoon with some bright spells developing too .
it will be a dry night for most , perhaps with odd spots of rain in the east .
more from bbc weather
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: crimewatch appeal over dorothy leyden 's murder in 1971
text: a fresh appeal to find the killer of a teenage girl who was raped and murdered in manchester 45 years ago is to feature on bbc one 's crimewatch .
dorothy leyden 's body was found hours after she had been to a jimmy ruffin concert at the golden garter nightclub in wythenshawe in april 197
the 17-year-old 's body was found on waste ground in collyhurst .
her sister pat atkinson has made an emotional appeal for more information on her death .

documents.title: stone roses singer ian brown avoids driving ban - so he can go shopping for elderly parents
text: stone roses frontman ian brown escaped a driving ban by claiming he needs his car - to do shopping errands for his elderly parents .
author: Manchester Evening News

documents.title: man wanted by police
text: a man from burnage is wanted by police .
leon seale-edwards , 36 , is wanted in connection with a domestic-related assault on 11 august .
he is also wanted on recall to prison .

documents.title: power cut in m14 postcode
text: engineers are on their way to investigate a power cut in the m14 postcode area affecting ladybarn and fallowfield .
we are aware of a power cut in the # m14 # manchester area , engineers are on route to investigate .
we do apologise about any inconvenience zee
do you know how many properties are affected ?
hi , there is 67 properties affected that we are aware of right now .
zee
do you know which roads in ladybarn are affected ?
is santon ave one of them ?
hi , our records show that the power in this area has now been restored , if you are still having issues can you please dm 1/2
do you know how long it takes to get fixed ?
it 's the second time in less than a week now this has happened .
i do apologise for the inconvenience that this fault is causing .
would you be able to dm your full address details please .

documents.title: developer selected for manchester regeneration
text: a developer has been appointed for an £ 850m regeneration project in manchester .
the mayfield scheme will be built on a derelict site next to piccadilly station and will include 1,300 homes , offices , a hotel , as well as retail and leisure facilities and a park .
a company called u + i has been selected to carry out the development with a planning application likely to be submitted in spring next year .

documents.title: latest headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire
text: latest headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire

documents.title: can dna tests identify litter louts ?
text: whether it is cutting-edge dna profiling or covert surveillance , online naming and shaming or conscience-pricking children 's artwork , bbc inside out has been exploring the different ways to stop dumping and littering .

documents.title: travel : broken-down lorry causing delays on m62
text: there are severe delays , queuing traffic and one lane is blocked on m62 eastbound between junction 19 , heywood , and junction 20 , rochdale , because of a broken down lorry .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: figures show costs of fly-tipping
text: the scourge of fly-tipping across england is getting worse with councils spending more than £ 67m to clean up public land and prosecute anyone they catch , according to official figures .
a total of £ 1.6m was spent in manchester last year and the council deals with up to 60 incidents a day

documents.title: football : players low on confidence - mourinho
text: manchester united manager jose mourinho says his players are low on confidence .
they were beaten 3-1 by watford on sunday .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: plans to rebuild oldham secondary school set to be approved
text: plans to rebuild royton and crompton secondary school at a cost of £ 17.5m are set to be approved by oldham council .
the cash would be used to build a new school on the current site , with room for 1,500 pupils .
it is hoped £ 14m will come from the education funding agency , with oldham council making up the rest .

documents.title: latest headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire
text: latest headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire

documents.title: appeal to find killer of teenager 45 years ago
text: a fresh appeal to find the killer of a teenage girl who was raped and murdered in north manchester 45 years ago will feature on crimewatch tonight .
dorothy leyden,17 , had been to watch the temptations soul singer jimmy ruffin , at the golden garter nightclub in wythenshawe in 1971 .
her body was found the next morning , behind a pub in collyhurst .

documents.title: trapped man freed by firefighters
text: a man who was trapped between a lorry and metal racking in store street in ancoats has been freed by firefighters .
north west ambulance service said he had been taken to manchester royal infirmary at about 09:30 .
the man was admitted as a `` major trauma patient '' but there are no further details about his condition , a spokesperson added .
greater manchester fire and rescue service was called at about 07:45 to the incident near to ducie street and great ancoats street .

documents.title: man trapped between metal and hgv in ancoats
text: a worker has been trapped between metal racking and a hgv at a business in manchester .
there is a cordon in place around ducie street and store street in ancoats while firefighters try to free the man .
ambulance and police were also called at about 07:45 .

documents.title: family of viola beach 's river reeves cycle in his name
text: family and friends of one of the members of warrington band viola beach , who died in a car crash in sweden , are beginning a 400-mile bike ride today , to raise money for a charity in his name .
river reeves lived in cornwall , before moving to warrington and joining the band .
his father will be among a group cycling from penzance to warrington , in aid of disadvantaged youngsters .

documents.title: sister appeals to find killer of teenage girl in 1971
text: a fresh appeal to find the killer of a teenager whose body was discovered dumped on waste ground in 1971 has been launched by police .
crimewatch : sister of dorothy leyden , who was raped and murdered in 1971 in mcr , makes appeal to find the killer .

text: headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire

documents.title: weather : turning dry with bright spells later
text: after a grey and damp start to the day it will start to dry up into this afternoon .
some bright spells will develop too and the winds will be light .
highs of 16c .

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: welcome to greater manchester live .
we 're here until 18:00 with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather from across the 10 boroughs and east cheshire .
you can get in touch with all your comments , photographs and news by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Rachael Connors
Reporter, BBC News Online
